Memorandum of the receipt of 18s. 8d. from the rector of Wyrlynworth, by Robert, abbot of Bury St. Edmund, the receiver of the 10ths for the archdeaconries of Suffolk and Sudbury, in payment of the priest moiety. Dated 14 November, 12 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Suffolk 125.

WISSET. Matilda, wife of Nicholas de Breton, grants to sir John, son of Oliver de Yaux, six-pence of annual rent in the village of Wisete. (c. 1270-80.)
MS. Ch. Suffolk 1213.

Juliana, wife of John Redhed of Wyssete, quit-claims to William de Nerford and Petronilla his wife, all right and claim in four acres of land in the village of Wyssete. Dated at Wyssete the Sunday next before the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin, 21 Ed. I. MS. Ch. Suffolk 1214.

Hobert Dilhegges of Wyssete grants to the lady Petronilla de Nerford and her heirs, a capital messuage in Wyssete with arable lands, woods, fields, &c. which he has in the villages of Wyssete, Rumburgh, Spectishale, Halesworthe and Holton
supplying him with sustenance during his life and half a mark yearly for shoes. Dated at Wyssete the Wednesday next before the feast of St. Mark the evangelist, 4 Ed. II. [With seal, broken.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 518.
WOODBRIDGE. Hugh, son of Sewall de Wdebrigge, grants to William de Suwalde a piece of land and a house in Wdebrigge, for. 20s. (c. 1240.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 1433.

WOODBRIDGE (Priory of). John de Hadeleye, prior of St. Mary, Wodebrigge, and canons of the same, grant to John dil Wode of Brandiston, one piece of land in Brandiston, at an annual rent of 8d. Dated at Wodebregge the Friday next after the feast of St. John ante port. Lat., 24 Ed. III. [With small fragment of seal.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 1457.

WORTHAM. John, son of Robert de Wurtham, quit-claims in full court, to Samson, the abbot of St. Edmund, and his successors, William and Wimer, sons of Elfwin de Wurtham, their chattels and service and with all that belongs to them, for 11 marks which Robert de Bosco gave to him in order that said Robert might hold them from the abbot; and for this quit-claim the abbot releases from an annual payment of 2d. (c. 1190-1200) [Sampson, abbot, 1182-1211.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 22.

Thomas, son of John de Thweyt, grants to Henry, abbot of St. Edmund, the whole of his mill and three roods of land in Herewardestoft which he holds in the village of Wortham. For this donation the said abbot gave 40s. sterling. [Henry, abbot, 1234-48.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 39.
Robert Dewlond of Wurtham grants to Henry, the abbot, and convent of St. Edmund, one piece of land in the village of Wurtham, for which the abbot gave him 5s. (1234-48.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 45.

Katherine, daughter of William le Waleis, and Aelicia her sister grant and quit-claim to Henry, abbot of St. Edmund, and his successors, for 4s. all right, &c. in 12 acres of land in the village of Wurham, about which there had been a plea at Redgrave by writ de recto. (1234-48.) [With part of seal.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 51.

Ralph, son of Baudewin of Culpho, of Wrtham, grants to Simon, abbot of St. Edmund, and his successors, all his right and claim to Anselm Dusyng of Wrtham and all his belongings, together with 2s. 6d. annual quit-rent of the same Anselm, issuing from a tenement which William Yehowe formerly held in Wrtham. (c. 1260.) [With part of seal.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 56.

Ralph, son of Baldwin de Culfho, is bound in 6 marks to Simon, abbot of St. Edmund, and his successors, that neither he nor his heirs
have claim or right to Anselm Dusing of Wortham or of hie suit, &c. (c. 1260.) [With seal almost obliterated.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 57.

Robert Peytevyn and Sabina his wife acknowledge to have received of the abbot of St. Edmund, for the use of Ralph de Culfho, son and heir of the said Sabina, eight marks, for a quit-claim which the said Ralph made to the said abbot and his successors of Anselm Dusing, with a tenement, service and 2s. 6d. quit-rent from the said Anselm, likewise a tenement formerly held by William Ilhowe in the village of Wortham. Dated at Brocford the Monday next after the feast of St. Hilary, 44 Hen. III. MS. Ch. Suffolk 58.

John Science of Gernemuth impledges to Roger, son of Richard Ingald of Wrtham, 7 acres of arable land in the fields of Wrtham, to hold from the Friday next before the feast of the apostles SS. Simon and Jude, 23 Ed. I, to the Nativity following, for a loan of 40s. MS. Ch. Suffolk 1434.

Symon de Hotone and Eglentin his wife grant to Gilbert Manton of Wrtham for 6s. one piece of land computed at half an acre in the field of Litlemor, paying annually for the same 2d. (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 1435.

Giles de Wachesham, kt., confirms to William de Hereford, rector of half the church of Wortham, for the sum of two marks the homage of Richard, son of Hervy Ingold, with all his issue and chattels. (c. 1260.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 1436.

Henry de Fincham, chaplain, grants to Hugh, son of Robert Hare of Wrtham, for his homage and service, one messuage and all that belongs to it in Wrtham, called Chelewalvestuft, paying yearly 12d. (c. 1280-90.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 1437.

William de Hereford, rector of half of the church of Wortham, grants to Richard, son of Hervy Ingold (whom sir Giles de Wachesham gave unto him with his issue), to be free with all that belongs to him, for which he shall pay one penny yearly at the altar, on the day of Nativ. B.V.M. for the maintenance of the light, and to the grantor and his heirs three roots of ginger. (c. 1260.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 1438.

Simon ... grants to John ... of the same village and his heirs, twenty pence of annual rent that he was accustomed to receive in the village of Wortham. Dated at Wortham .... 2 Hen. VI. [Partly effaced.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 1439.

WRATTING (Great). Confirmation by Walter, bp. of Norwich, of a composition between the abbey and monks of Bec, and Walter, rector of the church of Great Wratting, concerning the tithes of Great Wratting, as settled in 1247 by the priors of Benetlay and Hermodesworth, papal delegates. Dated at Norwich, iij Kl. May, 1248. [With fragment of seal.] MS. Ch. Suffolk 1440.

Peter de Taleworth, kt., grants to Robert his son the tenement which Alice le Roc of Little Samford formerly held in the village of Great Wrattinge, paying annually sixpence. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Suffolk 1441.

Returns of the execution of a writ dated 3 July, 4 Hen. IV, to the sheriff of Suffolk, that he shall make replevin to Philip Miller of Great Wrottyng of his cattle which Mirabella Geddyng and others took and detained. MS. Ch. Suffolk 1442.

BARTON (Little). Court roll for Little Berton, manor of the abbey of St. Edmund Bury dated the Thursday after the feast of St. Barnabas, 1 Ed. IV before Rich. Rynstede prior and cellarer. Do. held the Monday before the feast of St. Margaret, 2 Ed. IV. Do. held the Monday before the feast of St. Margaret, 4 Ed. IV. Court held 7 June, 15 Ed. IV before W. Mildenhale, cellarer. Do. held 27 June, 16 Ed. IV. Court of Little Barton, held 24 June, 17 Ed. IV. Do. held 24 Feb., 17 Ed. IV. Do. held on the vigil of St. Michael, 18 Ed. IV. Court held 10 Sept., 13 Hen. VII; time of Will. Codenlam, cellarer. Do. on the feast of St. Benedict, 13 Hen. VII; Will. Dersham, cellarer. The court held the Monday after the translation of St. Benedict, 14 Hen. VII. [Four membranes; of two of them only the top lines remain. Had lost 2 fols. before being calendared E.W.B.N. (NUS)] MS. Rolls Suffolk 1.

BURY ST. EDMUND (Abbey of). Copies of grants to St. Saviour's hospital, without Bury North gate, written temp. Hen. VII. With an indorsement of its having been produced by Thomas Martin in a suit in the exchequer, 11 Nov. 1755. G. Burton v. J. Holden and W. Trowell. MS. Rolls Suffolk 2.

(a) Sampson, the abbot, and convent of St. Edmund grant, in frankalmoigne, to the hospital of St. Saviour without the town of St. Edmund, the place upon which the said hospital is built, also £12 of silver from their village of Ykelingham and two portions of their church of Meleford, also two portions of the demesne tithes of Wirlingwrd, Saham, Tilneie, Elmeswell, Elvedene, Heringwell, Neuton, Cokefeld, and in the same village of Cokefeld annually 8 acres of corn the third portion of the demesne tithes of Pakynham, Rungeton, Tifteshall, Culeford, Horningesherth and Chelisworth; also they grant all the tithes of their new assarts in the villages of Redgrave and Rekinghalle, and a third portion of the tithe of the marsh of Tilneie, also their houses of Teleforh, saving to the monastery an annual service of 2s., and to the canons 12d. (b) Confirmation of the above grant by John, bp. of Norwich; giving the names of the rector of all the aforenamed churches. Dated at Norwich by the hands of David de Ruddebi, 17 Kl. August, 6th year of his episcopate. (c) Confirmation of the same by S., the prior, and convent of Norwich. (d) Confirmation of by archbishop Boniface of the same. Dated at St. Edmund Bury, 12 Kl. March, 1266. Long roll of pleas and fines of the manors of the cellarer of St. Edmund , for the third year of S. de Wighal. [Temp. Hen. III.] (c. 1260-70?) MS. Rolls Suffolk 3.

A roll of five membranes containing copies of 34 writs of enquiry etc. from the crown to the sheriff of Suffolk, respecting various possessions and privileges of the abbey of St. Edmund, various parishes. [Temp. Ed. III.] The names of the sheriffs are added and occasional name(?) of the returns. MS. Rolls Suffolk 4.

Part of a Roll of evidence and King's writs [produced to Robert Bacon, sheriff of Norfolk, 46 Ed. III], by the abbot and convent of St. Edmund on the one part, and the bp. of Ely on the other, touching the extent of their liberties; [probably in connection with the preceding roll]. MS. Rolls Suffolk 5.
A rental of payable ffor the meassuages, lands [etc.] belonginge to the common profits of the town at Bury St. Edmund, made 4 Feb., 5 James I, A.D. 1607. [On paper.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 6.

CHILTON. Extract of pleas at Westminster before Robert Danby and other justices, in Easter term, 10 Ed. IV, and Hilary term 49 Hen. VI for co. Suffolk, in a cause between Robert Crane and Isabella his wife against Ralph West and Katherine his wife, concerning a toft and 7 acres of land in Chilton. MS. Rolls Suffolk 7.
DALHAM. Rent rolls of the manor of Dalham, and "de novo redditu de ten. merveillous per annum ad aulam de Dalham", 18 Edw. III. MS. Rolls Suffolk 9.

EDWARDSTOWN, &c. Rental Johannes Algood, jun., "modo Willelmi Forthe, factum per recognicionem tenencium in vill of Edwardeston, Parva Waldyngfeld et Magna Waldyngfeld, Grotene et in com. Suff." 9 April, 12 Ed. IV. MS. Rolls Suffolk 10.
The rental of John Algood, jun., [as in MS. Rolls Suffolk 10] feast of St. Michael, 29 Hen. VI. MS. Rolls Suffolk 11.
FLEDEHALL with WALTHAM in STONHAM. Courts of Robert Crane, esq., in 31 Henry VIII, 1, 3, 6 Ed. VI, and 1, 10, 13 Elizabeth. [8 membranes.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 12.

FLIXTON (Priory of). Long roll, of 13 membranes, containing articles, interrogatories, depositions, &c. taken before delegates in the diocese of Norwich relating to a dispute between the parishioners of Fundenhall, Norfolk, and Margaret Hovel the prioress and convent of Flixton, concerning the repairs of Fundenhall church, Dec. and Jan. A.D. 1376-77; forming only a portion of the complete record, a reading is prefixed by Tho. Martin, and there is also an endorsement in the land writing of P. Laheve. MS. Rolls Suffolk 13.
GAPTON and BELTON. The account of John Gyle, collector of the rents there, from the feast of St. Michael, 36 Hen. VI, to Mich., 37 Hen. VI. MS. Rolls Suffolk 14.

GLEMSFORD. An abstract of the fines and amercements at the court leet and court baron there holden upon Saturday in Easter Week, 27 April, 20 Charles I, 1644, attested by Henry Cults, seneschal. MS. Rolls Suffolk 15.
HARDLEY. The account of John Hekyngham, 5 Hen. IV, for the manor of Hardele. [Partly effaced on the back.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 16.

HOXON. The account of William Gryse, bailiff and farmer of the demesne lands and parsonage of Hoxon, and of Thomas Thurston, provost there, from Michaelmas, 7 Hen. VI, to Mich., 8 Hen. VI. [5 membranes.} MS. Rolls Suffolk 17.

IPSWICH. Pleas before Simon de Rochester, Walter de Opton, Richard de Boyland, Robert Fitz-Fulk, Master Thomas de Sydrington, and Walter de Strechyesleye, justices itinerant at Ipswich, on the morrow of [All] Souls, 14 Ed. I, beginning of the 15th of his reign. [For the greater part effaced.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 18.

IPSWICH (Priory of St. Peter at). Part of a roll indorsed 'Visitatio Sancti Petri, Gippeswic', containing charges against Thomas Verdoun, the cellarer, and Clement de Ipswich, the sacrist, and their answers. [Temp. Edw. III.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 19.

KESSINGLAND. Six membranes, mutilated: The two first courts of John Megre, son of and heir to Richard Megre, and of his feoffees, dated Monday before feast of St. Tho. Ap. and feast of St. Botulph, 6 Rich. II. Courts for 7 and 11 Rich. II. Do. Mich. 16 Rich. II. Do. Feb. 17 Rich. II. Do. 18-23 Rich. II. Do. 20, 21, 22 and 23 Rich. II. MS. Rolls Suffolk 20.
MILDENHALL. Account of Bartholomew Bernard, provost of the manor of Mildenhall, for 17 Ed. II. MS. Rolls Suffolk 21
Roll of the manor court of Mildenhall, of Charles, earl of Winchelsea, held 10 March, 1706 by Humphrey Wall, gent., seneschal there. MS. Rolls Suffolk 22.
NEWTON. The account of Geoffrey Mundekyn, provost of William de Athirby in the manor of Newton, from Michaelmas, 7 Ed. III, to the same feast, 8 Ed. III. MS. Rolls Suffolk 23.

The court of Roger Wolferstoun, Robert Hothot, and their fellows, held at Newton the Monday after the feast of the Purification of the Blessed Virgin, 21 Rich. II. Court held 25 April, 18 Rich. II Do. 7 Feb., 16 Rich. II. Do. the Friday after St. Mark's day, 13 Rich. II. MS. Rolls Suffolk 24.
PRESTON. The account of John Watres, bailiff, and John Bonde, provost of the manor of Preston, from Mich., 5 Rich. II, to Mich., 6 Rich. II. [Almost entirely effaced.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 25.
SAXHAM. Coloured survey and description of Great Saxham, parcel of the possessions of sir Thomas Kytson, kt., taken and made in the month of September, 33 Elizabeth. MS. Rolls Suffolk 26.

SNAPES and ALDEBURTH. A roll, dated 1263, 2nd year of prior John of Snapes, showing that on the petition of their tenants of Snapes and Aldeburth the services due from them have been commuted for an annual payment, with the sums each tenant has to pay yearly placed in a line with their names (in number 54) under the heads of the old rent, and "pro ovibus, pro averagiis, pro ferminghund et gest et de garbis uncorum". MS. Rolls Suffolk 27.

SOMERLEYTON, &c. Roll, [temp. Ed. II], being a rent coll. in the parishes of Somerletun, Blundeston, Flixton, Hopthone, Askeby, Fretone, and Little Yarmouth. [Heading of roll gone, injured by water and in part illegible.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 28.
The account of William Fleg, servant of John de Gerneg[an] from Michaelmas, [33?] Ed. III, to the same feast, 34 Ed. IIII, for the manor of Somerleyton. [Heading mutilated.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 29.

[WALDINGFIELD?] SUFFOLK. Roll of rents, services, and customs due to Henry de Dote, both from the free and customary tenants, for the homage of Pykot, Badele, del Storkesnest, land of Sweyn ("terram Sweyn"), &c. [Temp. Hen. III or Edw. I.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 30.

SUFFOLK and SUDBURY, Archdeaconries of. Long list of subscribers, clergy and laity, promising annual contributions to the Trustees of the Society for the relief of clergymen's widows and orphans, A.D. 1723. MS. Rolls Suffolk 31.

WALDINGFIELD (Great). The court roll for the manor of Great Waldingfield, held the Tuesday on the vigil of the Epiphany, 41 Ed. III; Wedn. in feast of Transl. of St. Thomas, 41 Edw. III, and the Thursday after the feast of the Conversion of St. Paul, 42 Ed. III and the Thursday after Easter. also 2 other courts for the same years. MS. Rolls Suffolk 32.
Court rolls, of two courts 4 [Rich.] II. [Heading mutilated.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 33
Court roll of the manor of Great Waldingfield, held the Tuesday next after the feast of the Translation of St. Thomas the martyr, 16 Rich. II. MS. Rolls Suffolk 34.
The rental off the Badleys in Myche Waldyngfeld in the county of Suffolk. [Temp. Henr. VII or early Hen. VIII.] MS. Rolls Suffolk 35.
WICKHAM. Court roll, held the Friday on the feast of the Seven Sleepers, 4 Ed. III. MS. Rolls Suffolk 36.

WRATTING (Manor of). Court roll of courts held Monday in Oct. of St. Mich., on vigil of SS. Simeon and Jude and Monday before Palm Sunday, 15 Ed. I, also for the manor of Stapilford on the same membrane, Wedn. after feast of St. Mich., on the day of St. Vincent, and on the day of St. Sexburga, in the same year. MS. Rolls Suffolk 37.
